name: Ktiseos Nyx LoRA Trainer
description: ⚠️ BETA: In active development - may not work as expected. Professional LoRA training environment for SDXL, SD 1.5, Flux, and SD3. Features a modern Next.js web UI with comprehensive training configuration, real-time monitoring, dataset management, and automatic captioning. Powered by Kohya's sd-scripts with LyCORIS support. Uses vendored backend for reliable deployment.
author: Duskfall

launch_mode.description: Jupyter+SSH mode recommended for debugging and manual intervention if services fail

provisioning.description: Automatic setup script that clones repo, installs dependencies, builds frontend, and starts services

features: Modern Next.js web interface with 7-tab training configuration
Support for SDXL, SD 1.5, Flux, and SD3 model architectures
18 optimizer options including AdamW8bit, Prodigy, CAME, and more
Advanced LoRA variants: LoRA, LoCon, LoKR, DoRA, LoHa, GLoRA, BOFT
Automatic dataset captioning with WD14 taggers and BLIP
Real-time training monitoring and log streaming
File browser for easy dataset and model selection
Comprehensive validation with field-specific error messages
Block-wise learning rates and advanced LyCORIS parameters
FP8 training support for memory efficiency
Built-in utilities for LoRA resizing and HuggingFace uploads
Optional Jupyter Lab and TensorBoard integration
quick_start: 1. Access the web UI at http://localhost:3000
2. Navigate to Files page to upload your dataset
3. Go to Dataset page to organize and caption images
4. Configure training parameters in the Training page
5. Click 'Start Training' and monitor progress in real-time
6. Download your trained LoRA from the output directory
